text:
CUTTINGS FROM THE COMIC JOURNALS
(From Punch.)

GROUND GAME.—Lawn Tennis.

MIDSUMMER APPEALS.—Appeals for ice, claret-cup, picnics, garden-parties, and light summer dresses.

GROUND GAME, &c.!!—Squire (rather perplexed): Hullo, Pat! Where did you get the hare?—Pat: Shure Surr, the cr'atur' was wand'rin' about, an' I thought I'd take't to the "Wanes"!!—Squire: But did the keeper see you?—Pat: Bliss yer honour, I've been lookin' for him iver since I caught him!!

(From Funny Folks.)

WHAT France says to the Jesuit.—"Go father, and fare worse."

THE PORTES TO THE POWERS.
Of territory you are all so greedy,
You make me cede a lot because I'm seed-y!

A NEW DEPARTURE.—Actors have always been good at "gags," but they have hitherto been confined to the stage. Gagging now extends to audiences.

(From Punch.)

A GOOD PLACE FOR BREEDING RABBITS—Co(l)ney Hatch!

LUMBERLY DELUSIONS.—That the new steel corvettes in our navy are provided with steel-yards, and that they use these steel-yards to weigh their anchors with.

MIDSUMMER MADNESS.—Wagmore: Now, girls, what queen of antiquity surpassed even Titania in her fondness for donkeys?—You give it up?—Why, Dido, of course, for she fell in love with any ass.—Eras, don't you see.

(From Judy.)

NOTICE OF MOTION.—The railway whistle.

FOOD FOR THE MIXED.—Candles.

A MEAN (MIEN) ADVANTAGE.—Superiority in appearance.

QUITE RIGHT, DEAR.—Girl looking at herself in pretty bathing-dress): It does seem a dreadful pity to wet it.

ARK-ISHNESS.—First Young Lady: I hate this horrid walking; we look just like the animals coming out of the ark.—Second ditto: Ark-adian bliss compared to this, Maude; they had a gentleman to see them out. Noah would be decidedly preferable to Miss M'Stinger.

(From Moonshine.)

"DISTRESSED UNIONS."—Bad marriages.

WHAT the Theatrical Manager said when he found the dress-circle, second-circle, and upper-circle all empty.—"Oh, ye tiers!"

HISTORY LESSON.—School Teacher: Now, then! Next boy, George III., died in 1820, who came after him?—Scholar: Dunno, sir.—School Teacher: Next boy, then.—Scholar: The undertakers, sir.

THE troops, on their return from Windsor last week, got thoroughly drenched. This is not to be wondered at, considering that the review was held in the reign of Victoria.
